Posts.Content: kccatz wrote: I've been reading a lot of the posts and feel some comfort from all the information that is here. However, I'm feeling very overwhelmed and scared. It took about a month for all the testing to be completed and the bad news to come - stage IV, grade 3, 5+ cm, ER+, HER2+. I was just put on femara and took my 4th pill last night. I have a lot of confidence in my doctor and am told he's one of the best in the area, but just taking 1 little pill doesn't give me any confidence that I'm really fighting this aggressively. I understand the process mentally but emotionally I want him to do mascectomy, radiation, chemo, the works. Could really use some words of support.
